item.name: Stranger Things
item.overview: When a young boy vanishes, a small town uncovers a mystery involving secret experiments, terrifying supernatural forces, and one strange little girl.

topicItemStats.comment: In episode 4 season 2 it shows a cat being eaten

comments.comment: In episode 4 season 2 it shows a cat being eaten

topicItemStats.comment: No DOG dies, a cat does, and there is a different space for that on this list.

comments.comment: No DOG dies, a cat does, and there is a different space for that on this list.

topicItemStats.comment: In the first season, episode three Eleven has a flashback from when she was in a laboratory, where she is asked to kill a cat in a cage with her powers. The cat is obviously scared and Eleven can't bring herself to hurt it.

topic.name: animals are abused
topic.keywords: animal pet abuse torture blood cage trap neglect beaten skinned starve
topic.description: Some animals don't necessarily die, but are severely abused. Are there graphic details about animals being beaten, bloodied, skinned  alive, trapped in cages, starved, or neglected?

comments.comment: In the first season, episode three Eleven has a flashback from when she was in a laboratory, where she is asked to kill a cat in a cage with her powers. The cat is obviously scared and Eleven can't bring herself to hurt it.

topic.name: there's dog fighting
topic.description: Dog fighting is forcing dogs to fight each other for the sake of human entertainment. It’s gruesome, heartbreaking, and cruel.
topic.subtitle: ASPCA - Dog Fighting

topicItemStats.comment: Spiders and a butterfly in season 2 episode 7.

comments.comment: Spiders and a butterfly in season 2 episode 7.

topicItemStats.comment: near the end of s1ep5 there's a dying deer crying out it seems it was hit by a car and left to agonize, they were gonna shoot it to put the poor thing out of its misery but something quickly snatches it away, it's obviously computerized but still realist and painful to watch. Highkey upset that no one mentioned this before and that I had to see it myself

comments.comment: near the end of s1ep5 there's a dying deer crying out it seems it was hit by a car and left to agonize, they were gonna shoot it to put the poor thing out of its misery but something quickly snatches it away, it's obviously computerized but still realist and painful to watch. Highkey upset that no one mentioned this before and that I had to see it myself

topicItemStats.comment: s2e4 around 41:25 there is a dead cat being eaten by a monster. it is graphic.

topic.name: there's a dead animal
topic.keywords: puppy kitten dog cat horse cow

comments.comment: s2e4 around 41:25 there is a dead cat being eaten by a monster. it is graphic.

topicItemStats.comment: No horses are seen, as far as I know. There is a deer that is seen injured, however, and it is grabbed by a creature. We later see the creature eating something, which is presumably the deer.

comments.comment: No horses are seen, as far as I know. There is a deer that is seen injured, however, and it is grabbed by a creature. We later see the creature eating something, which is presumably the deer.

topicItemStats.comment: No actual snakes, but snake like things that are a cross between moving limbs and vines, in final episode of season one, one of these is pulled from someone's throat. More are seen in later seasons

comments.comment: No actual snakes, but snake like things that are a cross between moving limbs and vines, in final episode of season one, one of these is pulled from someone's throat. More are seen in later seasons

topicItemStats.comment:
SEASON 4 SPIDER WARNINGS - (tried to be as vague as possible but potential spoilers)
time stamps are as close as I could get them and this is hopefully all of them but I apologize if I missed one!

Episode 1-
- 46:43- 46:53 character is in the woods and sees a grandfather clock and as they are walking towards it you see a swarm or spiders come out of the clock and through the glass. Once you hear them bump into another character and they ask if their okay you can look.

- 1:10:48-1:10:59 character is running away and sees a table covered with flies and spiders, when you hear the buzzing of flies look away. Very brief but gross.

Episode 2-
- 1:09:17-1:09:30 character falls into open grave and spiders come out of a skull he sees when he turns his head; very brief only 5ish spiders 

- 1:11:40 you hear spider/bug sounds but don’t see any and it’s more just creepy crawly sounds not spider specific 

Episode 3-
- Clear of spiders:)

Episode 4-
- 52:58- 53:12 character tries to turn on faucet for a bath and the water doesn’t come on, instead it pans over to the drain where a swarm or spiders come out of it. You see them once then it shows the character then you see them again, after the character runs down stairs you don’t see it again. They go back to the Tub and it’s just water.

- 54:27-54:41 character walks up to attic and looks around, not until he looks up do you see a single spider from the ceiling. When you hear “it had cursed out town” you can look.

- 1:09:38- 1:09:52 character is walking and you see all these small spider egg sacks and they step on one and as they lift their foot you hear and see a million baby spiders come out of it. It’s shows it twice. When you hear “come back to me” you can look. Though your can hear creepy crawly stuff through the scene but not spider specific sounds.

Episode 5-
- 49:40-50:11 no spiders but spider webs 

- 50:39- character reaches their hand into a air vent (with webs in it) and pulls out a glass jar with a dead spider in it and looks at it for a while. While doing so this character has a spider crawling up their arm which they don’t notice at first but when they do their scream and shake it off and drop the jar with the dead one in it which you see for a split second. Safe when you hear Nancy say “what’s wrong?” You see webs in the characters hair but no spiders

Episode 6-
- Spider free:)

Episode 7-
- 22:43-23:10 a character goes into a room and opens a floor vent and sticks their hand inside and a spider crawls up his arm and he looks at it for a while. When you hear “more than that” you’re good to look.

- 1:23:28- 1:23:46 look away at “gods of our world” you see the character looking a spiders in a jar then you see them drawing a spider then it shows the jar spider again. When you hear “but the human world was disrupting this harmony” you can look.
>>> hope this helps! See you all for volume 2!!

topicItemStats.comment: Not a dragon but a monster.

comments.comment: Not a dragon but a monster.

topicItemStats.comment: S3E6: a brief memory around minute 49. A husband is shown yelling at his wife accusing her of cheating. The wife throws plates, and a child tries to intervene. The husband is verbally abusive toward the wife, pushes the child out of the way, and punches his wife in the face. These same memories are shown quickly in the middle of S3E8.

comments.comment: S3E6: a brief memory around minute 49. A husband is shown yelling at his wife accusing her of cheating. The wife throws plates, and a child tries to intervene. The husband is verbally abusive toward the wife, pushes the child out of the way, and punches his wife in the face. These same memories are shown quickly in the middle of S3E8.

topicItemStats.comment: A character happens upon a pool party and takes some voyeuristic photos of other characters at the party.

topic.name: someone is stalked
topic.description: Stalking can often appear as something small online but builds up over time and can lead to harassment and even violence from the perpetrator. It is an uncomfortable and distressing subject that some may not wish to view.

comments.comment: A character happens upon a pool party and takes some voyeuristic photos of other characters at the party.

topicItemStats.comment: Season one a kid's mother keeps being told she is crazy by the community, and in season three, a woman is repeatedly told she's imagining things by the men at her workplace and her boyfriend

topic.name: someone gets gaslighted
topic.description: Gaslighting is a form of psychological manipulation that seeks to sow seeds of doubt in a targeted individual or in members of a targeted group, making them question their own memory, perception, and sanity (Wikipedia). It’s no fun to be watching a film only for a character to find out they’ve been lied to and/or manipulated the whole movie.

comments.comment: Season one a kid's mother keeps being told she is crazy by the community, and in season three, a woman is repeatedly told she's imagining things by the men at her workplace and her boyfriend

topicItemStats.comment: S3E6: a brief memory around minute 49 of a father being verbally abusive and pushing his son out of the way in order to hit his wife. These same memories are shown quickly in the middle of S3E8.

comments.comment: S3E6: a brief memory around minute 49 of a father being verbally abusive and pushing his son out of the way in order to hit his wife. These same memories are shown quickly in the middle of S3E8.

topicItemStats.comment: Hopper is shown abusing alcohol and has a history of abusing the drug Tuinal (depicted in previous seasons but not this one).

topic.name: there's addiction
topic.description: A character has any sort of addiction, which includes gambling, tobacco or even anything that can be seen or used as a joke.

comments.comment: Hopper is shown abusing alcohol and has a history of abusing the drug Tuinal (depicted in previous seasons but not this one).

topicItemStats.comment: There's an allusion to Hopper's former drug addiction. S3E6 involves two characters being injected with drugs while captured. They end up vomiting in a bathroom but are ultimately fine.

comments.comment: There's an allusion to Hopper's former drug addiction. S3E6 involves two characters being injected with drugs while captured. They end up vomiting in a bathroom but are ultimately fine.

topicItemStats.comment: A boys father is an alcoholic, and it’s hinted at that one of the characters is as well

comments.comment: A boys father is an alcoholic, and it’s hinted at that one of the characters is as well

topicItemStats.comment: Will is restrained a few times in Season 2 in order to prevent the Mind Flayer from causing damage. In Season 3, Steve and Robin are tied back-to-back in chairs while being held captive by the Russians.

topic.name: someone is restrained
topic.description: A character is restrained. They have limited movement due to an outside source (not the same as paralysis). Example: a character is tied up, or has limbs encased with dried concrete.

comments.comment: Will is restrained a few times in Season 2 in order to prevent the Mind Flayer from causing damage. In Season 3, Steve and Robin are tied back-to-back in chairs while being held captive by the Russians.

topicItemStats.comment: Season 2 shows flashbacks of children and a girl's mom being tortured.

comments.comment: Season 2 shows flashbacks of children and a girl's mom being tortured.

topicItemStats.comment: season 4 ep one super gory at the end in eddies house

topic.name: there's excessive gore
topic.description: Some people can handle a bit of blood, but not things like organs and bones.

comments.comment: season 4 ep one super gory at the end in eddies house

topicItemStats.comment: S3E8: There is a close-up shot of a character's leg being sliced open with a knife.

comments.comment: S3E8: There is a close-up shot of a character's leg being sliced open with a knife.

topicItemStats.comment: broken teeth are seen when a villain's face is bashed in

comments.comment: broken teeth are seen when a villain's face is bashed in

topicItemStats.comment: No there is not

topic.name: there's genital trauma/mutilation
topic.keywords: penis vagina groin balls scrotum testicles

comments.comment: No there is not

topicItemStats.comment: There's no cannibalism in the sense of eating members of the same species, but some monsters eat people.

topic.name: there's cannibalism
topic.description: Although they have already proposed the categories "Zombies" and "Eaten Alive", cannibalism is a category apart from those two objectively speaking. For example, there are situations where a person is driven to cannibalism by circumstances (either forced by third parties or by desperation) or practice it without knowing it.

comments.comment: There's no cannibalism in the sense of eating members of the same species, but some monsters eat people.

topic.name: someone is crushed to death
topic.notName: no one is crushed to death
topic.description: A character is killed (or nearly killed) by crushing. Can include being trapped behind moving walls, being trapped inside a garbage compactor, being crushed by falling rocks/rubble/debris, or being run over by a car, tank, or other large vehicle.
topic.listName: where someone is crushed to death

topicItemStats.comment: A monster is burnt alive, but does not die.

comments.comment: A monster is burnt alive, but does not die.

topicItemStats.comment: A monsters arm is cut off

topic.name: there's amputation
topic.keywords: arm foot feet hand finger toe

comments.comment: A monsters arm is cut off

topicItemStats.comment: Brains are exploded. The head(s) remains in tact.

comments.comment: Brains are exploded. The head(s) remains in tact.

topicItemStats.comment: Nope. However many scenes of burning, torture attempts, shootouts, ect.

comments.comment: Nope. However many scenes of burning, torture attempts, shootouts, ect.

topicItemStats.comment: And the mayor almost has his finger cut off with a cigar cutter

comments.comment: And the mayor almost has his finger cut off with a cigar cutter

topic.name: there's Achilles Tendon injury
topic.description: Some people have severe phobias of tendon or ankle injuries, specifically when they're cut. Pet Sematary, Hostile, etc. show these in graphic detail. Even typing these examples and thinking about those scenes is making me nauseated.

topicItemStats.comment: No but in season 4, many characters levitate - if seeing bodies with feet off the ground is triggering for you, then do not watch.

comments.comment: No but in season 4, many characters levitate - if seeing bodies with feet off the ground is triggering for you, then do not watch.

topicItemStats.comment: Billy holds Eleven into the air by the neck in S3E6, which causes her to choke

topic.name: someone struggles to breathe
topic.keywords: choke choking suffocation suffocate strangle strangling
topic.description: Choking, suffocation, strangling, hyperventilating, and things similar can make people incredibly nervous for multiple reasons, such as personal experience.

comments.comment: Billy holds Eleven into the air by the neck in S3E6, which causes her to choke

topicItemStats.comment: A boy becomes possessed by a supernatural being. When a part of this supernatural being is burnt with a flamethrower, the boy is thrown onto the ground and starts to have a seizure.

comments.comment: A boy becomes possessed by a supernatural being. When a part of this supernatural being is burnt with a flamethrower, the boy is thrown onto the ground and starts to have a seizure.

topicItemStats.comment:
Season 4
A couple of teenagers are found dead with their missing and bloody 
S4E4
The prisoner is seen with scars over his eyelids, his eyelids remain closed showing these scars

comments.comment:
Season 4
A couple of teenagers are found dead with their missing and bloody 
S4E4
The prisoner is seen with scars over his eyelids, his eyelids remain closed showing these scars

topic.name: someone asphyxiates
topic.description: This applies mostly to Space-set content where the body goes through significant harm and deadly trauma when sucked into the vacuum of space but can apply to drownings, claustrophobic environments or violence (which many are particularly sensitive to post the death of George Floyd). Not only that but these situations can be scary for children to watch, the suddenness of many situations where they occur can frighten adults and all viewers should be able to go into a movie aware of what they could see.

topicItemStats.comment: Eleven breaks a kids arm in season one, because he was bullying Mike and Dustin. It is not that graphic, he just screams Ah! She broke my arm! Let's get out of here!"

comments.comment: Eleven breaks a kids arm in season one, because he was bullying Mike and Dustin. It is not that graphic, he just screams Ah! She broke my arm! Let's get out of here!"

topicItemStats.comment: in season one, mike nearly falls to his death, but is saved by eleven. i feel this should still be mentioned, since it's a very scary, suspenseful scene.

topic.name: someone falls to their death
topic.notName: no one falls to their death
topic.doesName: Does someone fall to their death
topic.listName: where someone falls to their death

comments.comment: in season one, mike nearly falls to his death, but is saved by eleven. i feel this should still be mentioned, since it's a very scary, suspenseful scene.

topicItemStats.doesName: Does someone fall to their death

topic.name: someone falls down stairs
topic.description:
I have a crippling fear of stairs, to the point where I use ramps when walking into restaurants, or I use the elevator to go up 1 floor. 

Characters falling down the stairs triggers this, and I'd like to have a category added so that I can be warned of this

topicItemStats.comment: Barbara is a teenager, who is killed and harvested by the Demogorgan

comments.comment: Barbara is a teenager, who is killed and harvested by the Demogorgan

topicItemStats.comment: Surprisingly, it’s never used, no less as a slur.

topic.name: the R word is used
topic.notName: the R word is not used
topic.description: This is a common and deeply upsetting trigger for developmentally disabled and autistic people, and can cause major panic attacks and meltdowns.
topic.listName: where the R word is used

comments.comment: Surprisingly, it’s never used, no less as a slur.

topic.name: someone overdoses
topic.description: Seeing a character overdose whether it is accidental or not can be extremely triggering for people with PTSD and the character taking drugs category is not specific enough to know if they overdose or not

topicItemStats.comment: Not exactly a toy, and it's the owner of the item that chooses to destroy it, but early in season 3 Will destroys his "Castle Byers" fort. Also, Joyce smashes a porcelain doll in season 4, but it didn't belong to anyone.

topic.name: A child's dear toy is destroyed
topic.description: Similar to having Santa (et al) ruined for a child, a child being in distress due to the damage or destruction of a dear toy such as a sentimental stuffed animal, or a gift from a beloved relative.
topic.listName: where a child's dear toy is destroyed

comments.comment: Not exactly a toy, and it's the owner of the item that chooses to destroy it, but early in season 3 Will destroys his "Castle Byers" fort. Also, Joyce smashes a porcelain doll in season 4, but it didn't belong to anyone.

topicItemStats.comment: A character named Bob who's introduced in the second season dies in episode 8 of the same season. He was dating Joyce, so he acted as a pseudo-father for Will and Jonathon. The death is graphically shown on screen.

comments.comment: A character named Bob who's introduced in the second season dies in episode 8 of the same season. He was dating Joyce, so he acted as a pseudo-father for Will and Jonathon. The death is graphically shown on screen.

topicItemStats.comment: She thinks about it, but backs out.

topic.name: someone cheats
topic.description: A character interacts romantically or sexually with someone while in a relationship with a different character. This could be triggering to someone who has been cheated on, or is uncomfortable with the subject.

comments.comment: She thinks about it, but backs out.

topicItemStats.comment: the russian base sequence might be a bit much if you have trouble with kidnapping/being caught and trapped

topic.name: someone is kidnapped
topic.description: Being kidnapped is a very traumatic experience and can be very distressing to read/watch as it almost always against the person's will.

comments.comment: the russian base sequence might be a bit much if you have trouble with kidnapping/being caught and trapped

topicItemStats.comment: season 3, at the fourth of july fair

comments.comment: season 3, at the fourth of july fair

topicItemStats.comment: I don't quite remember what episode but there was a part where Billy and Steve were talking while taking a shower at the school.

comments.comment: I don't quite remember what episode but there was a part where Billy and Steve were talking while taking a shower at the school.

topicItemStats.comment: There are MANY jumpscares ALL through the entire series. Sometimes mere scene-transitions are jumpscares simply because the 'from' scene is quiet and the 'to' scene is loud and abrupt.

comments.comment: There are MANY jumpscares ALL through the entire series. Sometimes mere scene-transitions are jumpscares simply because the 'from' scene is quiet and the 'to' scene is loud and abrupt.

topicItemStats.comment: No ghosts of the dead, but a kid is possessed by another living entity in season 2

comments.comment: No ghosts of the dead, but a kid is possessed by another living entity in season 2

topicItemStats.comment: This is a major theme in season two and even more in season three.

comments.comment: This is a major theme in season two and even more in season three.

topicItemStats.comment:
spoiler:

in season 4 when the vecna kills people, you can hear their bones breaking. you can also see it. in my opinion, it’s not that bad because it looks and sounds fake but it could be triggering to some. also, there is a lot of squishing sounds bc of the demogorgon things in the upside down. but that’s it for season 4

topic.name: There's audio gore
topic.description: Some people are not bothered by visual depictions of gore but may be sensitive to hearing realistic gory sounds like flesh squishing and bones crunching.

comments.comment:
spoiler:

in season 4 when the vecna kills people, you can hear their bones breaking. you can also see it. in my opinion, it’s not that bad because it looks and sounds fake but it could be triggering to some. also, there is a lot of squishing sounds bc of the demogorgon things in the upside down. but that’s it for season 4

SEASON FOUR WARNINGS!!!

- ep2 - NOT SAFE! lucas vomits in the toilet at between 9 and 10 minutes, right after you see the benny's burgers sign, with visual -
- ep3 - SAFE! at 26 minutes, for a brief moment we see the same scene of chrissy from ep1, this time we only see her kneeling near a toilet, no audio or visual -
- ep4 - SAFE! -
- ep5 - SAFE! -

- ep8 - SAFE! -
- ep9 - SAFE! steve spits quite a bit at 1 hour and 36 minutes -

topicItemStats.comment: Eleven appears to be having anxiety attacks several times after she rips off her blindfold

topic.name: someone has an anxiety attack
topic.description: Images of someone having an anxiety attack can trigger an attack in others.  It is not possible to function for a long time afterwards.

comments.comment: Eleven appears to be having anxiety attacks several times after she rips off her blindfold

topicItemStats.comment: There is some disgusting chewing in season 4 episode 6.

topic.name: there's misophonia
topic.description:
Misophonia, or "selective sound sensitivity syndrome", is a neurological disorder often associated with autism and ADHD, in which hearing mouth noises or repetitive sounds like eating, chewing gum, smacking lips, tapping, and other noises when eating, triggers anger, disgust, or even physical pain. 

Many movies and TV shows have moments like this, with some that are so extreme it becomes unwatchable for viewers who suffer from this, as I do. I have wished for this to be a category on this wonderful site for years.

comments.comment: There is some disgusting chewing in season 4 episode 6.

topicItemStats.comment: Hopper, a vet, suffers from PTSD. Will and Eleven also seem to suffer from it after their involvement with the upside-down. In S4, the main villain, Vecna, uses teenagers’ trauma to kill them and open gates— primarily seen with Max.

topic.name: someone suffers from PTSD
topic.description: There's a category for anxiety attacks, but for me PTSD functions differently. It may seem redundant, but as someone with PTSD, watching someone suffer from PTSD and exhibit symptoms can actually trigger my PTSD. I imagine some other people must feel similarly. Movies would fall into this category if a character talks about having Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder or becomes triggered.

comments.comment: Hopper, a vet, suffers from PTSD. Will and Eleven also seem to suffer from it after their involvement with the upside-down. In S4, the main villain, Vecna, uses teenagers’ trauma to kill them and open gates— primarily seen with Max.

topicItemStats.comment: in season 4 ep 4 nancy and robyn go to a mental hospital and you see many mentally ill patients but they are never violent

topic.name: a mentally ill person is violent
topic.notName: no mentally ill people are violent
topic.description: Showing a mentally ill person committing violent acts is a very specific and very focused trigger for mentally ill people, and people who love someone who is mentally ill. This is separate and distinct from demonizing mental illness. Many mentally ill people are shunned, abused, and murdered because people are frightened of them. Many mentally ill people are extremely poorly treated or even killed because so many people equate mental illness with violence. It is extremely upsetting for a mentally ill person to see a movie that tells them they are frightening and dangerous. Mentally ill people have enough to deal with without having to deal with terror and prejudice. Further, it is extremely upsetting to watch someone you love who has a mental illness watching a movie that shows someone like them being dangerous and violent.
topic.doesName: Is a mentally ill person violent
topic.listName: where a mentally ill person is violent

comments.comment: in season 4 ep 4 nancy and robyn go to a mental hospital and you see many mentally ill patients but they are never violent

topic.name: Autism specific abuse
topic.description: When an autistic person is abused specifically because they are autistic. This can include parents who openly complain about their child being "gone" or "different" than they want, bullying by others, medical-related abuse, and parents/relatives/others killing an autistic person because they're "sick" of their autistic behavior.

topic.name: there is a baby or unborn child
topic.description: Seeing a baby or unborn child can be triggering to those who have lost an infant or pregnancy, or who have lost a sibling. I lost a late-term pregnancy and seeing a baby unexpectedly can be a very painful reminder of that and trigger flashbacks. Additionally, unborn children (a fetus or embryo) are shown completely unexpectedly at times and can be similarly triggering to those who miscarried, were coerced or forced to have an abortion, or are infertile/unable to conceive. For examples, the horror movie "The Hallow" showed a (possibly dead/deceased) infant crawling across the ground toward a character, which was completely unexpected and irrelevant to the plot, and the TV series Helix had an extended plot depicting a fetus in vitro in the second season.
topic.doesName: Are there babies or unborn children

comments.comment: In season 4 episode 4, there are two brief but gruesome scenes of a baby on fire in a crib.

topicItemStats.comment: There isn't antisemitism, but a character who is experimented on has a shaved head and a tattoo of a number on her arm, which are very likely allusions to Josef Mengele's experiments during the Holocaust.

topic.name: there's antisemitism
topic.description: Is a movie antisemitic or has the portrayal of antisemitism/antisemitic characters? Are there negative Jewish stereotypes portrayed in the movie, are any explicitly or implied Jewish characters killed or abused? Does the movie feature Nazism/the holocaust? Is the director/write/lead actor a known antisemite? There is a lot of casual antisemitism in media, Jewish individuals (or people who don't want to support antisemitic movies in general) should have access to a warning before going to the theater.
topic.subtitle: Anti-Defamation League

comments.comment: There isn't antisemitism, but a character who is experimented on has a shaved head and a tattoo of a number on her arm, which are very likely allusions to Josef Mengele's experiments during the Holocaust.

topicItemStats.comment: Karen Wheeler and other women who look to be late 30s(maybe early 40s) have an interest towards Billy, who I believe is 19, in season 3. Billy asks out Karen for "swimming lessons" which she at first accepts but then changes her mind. Sure he is above 18 but still a pretty big maturity difference.

topic.name: there's a large age gap
topic.description: Some media depicts relationships/desire between people with large age gaps, either minors feeling romantically for adults or adults expressing interest in minors or people much younger than them. This section would allow people to tag whether there are relationships or desire to have a relationship with someone with a significant age gap or toward a minor, and more detail would be included in comments as to the specifics of the dynamic, as these dynamics can be distressing to witness on screen especially if you have personal experience with predatory behavior from those in a position of power over you.

topicItemStats.comment: I don't understand the 'yes' votes here.

topic.name: there are incestuous relationships
topic.description: Tracking incestuous relationships can be helpful for people that have been sexually assaulted and/or abused by siblings. It's important that this not only includes siblings by blood, but also other forms when they were raised as siblings most of their lives. Incest is also sexual relationships between a parent and their child. So people who went through sexual abuse/assault by a parent or maybe a grandparent will also benefit from not seeing any depicted relationships of that kind.
topic.subtitle: National Sexual Assault Hotline 800.656.4673

comments.comment: I don't understand the 'yes' votes here.

topicItemStats.comment: While no one is outright sexually assaulted, there is a scene near the end of episode 2 which greatly resembles sexual assault, using common stock phrases used in sexual assault scenes. People who are triggered by this may be just as bothered by this imagery

topicItemStats.comment: Billy had toxic masculinity forced on him after his parents divorced and his father verbally abuses him for crying. Jonathan details a time where he cried after his dad shot a rabbit, it’s not confirmed if he was ridiculed over it but it’s an easy inference to make and there’s talk of the dad being insensitive to Will’s emotions. El is ridiculed for crying but she's a girl and eventually kicks the ass of the main bully anyways.

topic.name: a male character is ridiculed for crying
topic.notName: no male characters get ridiculed for crying
topic.description: As someone who has been made fun of for crying multiple times by abusive friends, this is incredibly triggering. It's often portrayed as a joke, and it's just something I want to avoid. Many men are victims of abuse and get made fun of for it or told that they can't be abused, and would be helped by being able to know ahead of time whether or not that happens.
topic.doesName: Is a male character ridiculed for crying
topic.listName: where a male character is ridiculed for crying

Jonathan details a time where he cried after his dad shot a rabbit, it’s not confirmed if he was ridiculed over it but it’s an easy inference to make and there’s talk of the dad being insensitive to Will’s emotions. El is ridiculed for crying but she's a girl and eventually kicks the ass of the main bully anyways.

topic.name: someone is homeless
topic.description: A friend of mine has severe anxiety that is triggered by the premise of being homeless, due to trauma from having been homeless themself. It would be extremely helpful if there was some way to know which pieces of media have homeless characters, or characters that become homeless at some point so that my friend can avoid re-living this trauma. An example of this happening is in the movie A Dog's Journey.

comments.comment: Eleven more or less becomes this after escaping Hawkins Labs, it’s not until Season 2 where she finds somewhat stable housing in the form of Hopper
